text:
Fourth Avenue (right), at the S.E. corner of East 13th St. Shown is the 13th Street side of this triangular plot and its well covered fence. The American Theatre is presenting Tony Pastor; the large painting "the Army of the Potomac" is on display; Hooleys Opera House presents "Campbells"; the Hippotheatron displays the Harlequin Bluebeard; the Sunday Mercury advertises "the Fair Lillians" or "Life in Death"; Heller, J.F. Owens, a live Indian, Paul Pry appear in "the Heritage ----"; Bluebeard, Bryants Minstrels and Hoods Minstrels are on the adjoining boards. These theatres are in this vicinity, tho several changed their identities; Wallacks becoming the Star in 1881, and Bryants Minstrel Hall changing to Tony Pastors Theatre.

About 1870

Gift of Urbrock Collection

W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
According to the New York Times of March 31, 1938 the building housing Post office Station "D,' shown at the right will be demolished and
replaced by a 1-story gas station.
